IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO OPERATE AN INNOVATIVE PRIVATE SCHOOL THAT EDUCATES YOUNG MINDS AND PREPARES THEM TO THRIVE IN A GLOBAL SOCIETY.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE WILLISTON NORTHAMPTON SCHOOL INSPIRES STUDENTS TO LIVE WITH PURPOSE, PASSION AND INTEGRITY. THE SCHOOL'S PHILOSOPHY COMPRISES THE TENENTS OF RESPECT FOR SELF AND OTHERS, RESPONSIBILITY AND TRUST, AND HONESTY AND INTEGRITY. THE SCHOOL'S VALUES ARE ENCAPSULATED BY THESE TENENTS: ACADEMIC EXCELLENCE, INDIVIDUALITY, RESPONSIBILITY, COMMUNITY AND COLLABORATION.
IRS990.Desc: PROVIDE A SECONDARY EDUCATION FOR STUDENTS GRADES 7-12. WILLISTON IS A BOARDING SCHOOL WITH A DAY STUDENT POPULATION. ENROLLMENT IS APPROXIMATELY 508. IN ADDITION, WILLISTON PROVIDES STUDENT SERVICES SUCH AS FOOD SERVICE, HEALTH SERVICE, STUDENT PUBLICATIONS AND A VARIETY OF CLUBS AND ACTIVITIES FOR THE STUDENTS. WILLISTON ALSO PROVIDES SUPPLEMENTARY SERVICES SUCH AS A BOOKSTORE, A SNACK BAR, DAY CARE, ETC.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO STUDENTS AWARDED ON THE BASIS OF NEED ENABLES THE SCHOOL TO SERVE STUDENTS WHO OTHERWISE WOULD BE UNABLE TO ATTEND.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL'S ENDOWMENT CONSISTS OF APPROXIMATELY 250 INDIVIDUAL FUNDS FOR A VARIETY OF PURPOSES, INCLUDING INSTRUCTION, SCHOLARSHIPS, ADMINISTRATION, LIBRARY, BUILDINGS AND GROUNDS, PRIZES AND OPERATIONS.
FINANCIAL AID -6,777,821. CHANGE IN VALUE OF SPLIT INTERESTS -13,220. INVESTMENT FEES RELATED TO SPLIT INTERESTS -13,542. LOSS ON BOND REFINANCING -522,350. ROUNDING -2.
FINANCIAL AID 6,777,821. INVESTMENT FEES RELATED TO SPLIT INTERESTS 13,542.
THE WILLISTON NORTHAMPTON SCHOOL ADVERTISES IN BOTH INTERNAL AND EXTERNAL PUBLICATIONS ITS POLICY OF NONDISCRIMINATION ON THE BASIS OF RACE, RELIGION, NATIONAL ORIGIN, GENDER OR SEXUAL ORIENTATION.

ELIGIBLE STUDENTS RECEIVE A CREDIT ON TUITION

THE HEAD OF SCHOOL IS REQUIRED TO LIVE ON CAMPUS AS A CONDITION OF EMPLOYMENT.

BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.TransactionDesc: PROVIDES DINING SERVICES TO THE SCHOOL

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 IS E-MAILED TO THE AUDIT COMMITTEE AND THERE IS A FOLLOW-UP MEETING VIA CONFERENCE CALL. ONCE APPROVED BY THE AUDIT COMMITTEE, THE FORM 990, EXCLUDING SCHEDULE B, IS THEN PRESENTED TO THE FULL BOARD VIA E-MAIL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S BUSINESS OFFICE FOLLOWS UP BY COLLECTING ANNUALLY ACKNOWLEDGEMENTS BY BOARD MEMBERS THAT THEY HAVE RECEIVED AND UNDERSTAND THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY. THE ORGANIZATION'S CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY IS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMPARISON OF SALARIES WITH DATA COLLECTED FROM 40 PEER INSTITUTIONS IS USED. REASONABLE AND COMPETITIVE SALARIES ARE DETERMINED BASED ON THE DATA COLLECTED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
CHANGE IN VALUE OF SPLIT INTERESTS -13,220. ROUNDING -9. LOSS ON BOND REFINANCING -522,350.
THE PROCESS OF OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT OF THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND SELECTION OF AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
